page.title: 15FARMING DAIRY AND BEEF
page.content: There are 14 farms in this "D" block. Dairy farming is the major category but because of EEC regulations and restrictions on producing too much milk,many farmers are turning to beef cattle.Milk is collected daily by tanker and taken to Kirkby Malzeard dairy for cheese making or sent to Rowntrees in York for milk chocolate. The Regional Milk Marketing Board is in Harrogate.It organises transport, makes scientific tests on quality and helps farmers to sell their milk.The most popular breed of dairy cattle is the British Friesian.Favourite beef cattle are Limousin,Charolais,Angus and Hereford.Cattle markets used are at Pannal,Otley,Ripon,Northallerton, Pateley Bridge and Wharfedale.Feed is bought from Masham,York,Pickering, Driffield,Ripley and Tanfield.
